description: Change of Use from Dwelling to House in Multiple Occupancy (HMO) with associated parking for 2 cars and refuse and cycle enclosure
decision_conditions: The proposed development would result in the loss of a property that is suitable for family sized accommodation, thereby undermining the supply of housing within the Borough. The proposal would therefore be contrary to National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Policy DM14 of the Council's adopted Core Strategy (2012).

The proposed house in multiple occupation would represent an over-intensification of the use of the site to the detriment of the amenities and living conditions of the area and neighbouring occupiers respectively, in regards to unacceptable noise and disturbance. The proposal would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Policy DM10 of the Council's adopted Core Strategy (2012).

It has not been demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed development would not result in increased on-street car parking pressure which would lead to inconsiderate parking.  As such, the proposal is considered to conflict with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), and Policies DM9 and DM10 of the Council's adopted Core Strategy (2012).
Condition 8(cross-sections displaying windows, ventilation ducts and void areas)

Please provide a copy of proposed block plan scaled 1:500 showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.The scale bar and stated scale are different in the submitted proposed plan.

Please provide a copy of proposed block plan scaled 1:500 providing a scale bar showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.The submitted proposed block plan does not show the proposed development in hatched or shaded.
